text: what if energy drinks contained real
atomic energy we're talking about the
kind of energy released during
radioactive decay sound dangerous you
bet at the turn of the 20th century the
dangers of radiation poisoning were
largely unknown as a result some
companies ironically began marketing
radioactive products as a way to treat
illness and disease one famous product
was the energy drink called raided thorn
which was a mixture of water with a
highly radioactive element called radium
ray de Thor was manufactured from 1918
to 1928 by Bailey radium Laboratories
Bailey Labs claimed rated or give you
energy as well as cured a host of health
ailments they even suggested it as an
aphrodisiac only making it all more
popular
however most Americans never got their
hands on rated or since radium was
relatively rare and expensive to mine
and purified today a single bottle of
rated or would cost around fifteen
dollars but that price tag didn't deter
American industrialist and amateur
golfer Evan buyers Byers was introduced
to rated Thor by his doctor and the
drink eventually killed him when he
drink radium water eighty percent of the
radium leaves your body relatively
quickly while the remaining 20% enters
your bloodstream eventually reaching
your bones where it stays for good so a
few bottles would improve fatal the
buyers didn't drink just a few for years
he reportedly drank one to two bottles
of rated for a day by the time he died
at age 52
he had holes in his skull had lost most
of his job and his bones were so
radioactive that they had to be placed
in a lead-lined coffin since it takes
radium 16 hundred years to become half
as radioactive bars his bones will
remain highly radioactive well into the
next millennium
shortly after bars is death the
government closed down Bayley labs and
the FDA took more assertive action
against supposed radioactive medicine
requiring proof of their safety and
effectiveness this put a swift end to
the country's peculiar market for quacks
radioactive products but not before it
cost
man his life so the next time you power
down that energy drink be thankful it's
radium free
